transcript.text: Shalom good morning it is the fifth day
of all we are now right in the middle
between yom teruah and yom kippur again
I'm I'm not a morning person but yah
woke me up early this morning because he
wanted me to make a YouTube and share a
very personal testimony and it is very
personal and yet I think y'all wanted me
to share it because it will help some of
you out there if you read my
autobiography on my website at spirit
intercom it's called love never fails it
charts the years of my life between 1999
and 2010 and then there's another
section that even goes beyond that ever
since my ex-wife turned away from yah
and and divorced me and and then the
struggle I've had try to see my children
and she cut me off for my children it's
been really difficult for me because I
loved I loved being married I mean I it
was I loved it I loved having that
companionship and I loved everything
about marriage and for many years now
I've just I've cried out for a wife I've
wanted so much to find a wife who loves
yah and - and to be married again and
and then you know as I continue to
struggle and pray and cry out yah I had
this thought my mind well maybe I'll
meet my future wife in the safe place
you know when when we go to the safe
place for 3 and 1/2 years but that
actually is not the point because what
yah showed me was that I have to be
willing to lay that down and say that
you know even if I'm never married again
I've got to keep my focus on yah and and
love yah with everything in me and and
that's a hard thing I mean when you and
some of you know this and it may not be
marriage but there may be something that
you really desire and it's not
necessarily a bad thing but but yah
wants you to lay that down
and follow him anyway and then if he
decides to give it to you hallelujah if
not you just keep following him I know
that when I read the Autobiography for
Keith Green who was a actually was his
biography because his wife wrote but he
was a musician back in the late 70s
early 80s he was mightily anointed by
Yan and he died but there was a part
where I mean music was his life you know
as much as I want to be married he loved
music and at one point yaw told Keith
Green that he had to lay down his guitar
and lay down his music and he was
obedient to do that it was a painful
thing and he walked away from it to
serve yeah and then later as you keep
reading you find out that yaw allows him
to have that music back but but the
point was is that he had to be willing
to lay it down so I just want to
encourage any of you out there you know
we're entering this new season now that
we've come into yom teruah and if
there's anything that you desire even if
it's a good thing make sure that you lay
that down and that you keep yah as the
center of your life and you're gonna
follow him and love him and make him the
top priority no matter what and like i
said you know it's a very personal
testimony that i'm sharing but i I'm
doing this in the hopes that it will
help some of you out there who might be
struggling with maybe this issue that
I'm struggling with or or other issues
but that you need to lay it down and if
God decides to raise it up and give it
to you hallelujah but if not you just
you just follow him and his Shalom and
his peace and his joy and the fruits of
his spirit will be sufficient for you
his grace will be sufficient for you
hallelujah
this is Daniel John Lee with Torah
restoration ministries the website is
WWN for comm t-minus five days until the
highest holy day in all Scripture Yom
Kippur
hello
